Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support, as there is no official announcement or letter from President Magufuli or the Tanzanian government banning face masks.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Tanzania has banned face masks based on the articles published on certain websites, without verifying the information from reliable sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Magufuli and the Tanzanian government have not issued any ban on face masks.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that Tanzania has banned face masks when there is no evidence to support this.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on articles from websites that may not have accurate information.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Tanzania has not strictly enforced precautionary measures against COVID-19, such as wearing face masks, due to President Magufuli's belief in prayers and declaring the country free of COVID-19.
